title: Purchasing Commodity Data
description:
The San Francisco Controller's Office maintains a database of purchasing activity from fiscal year 2007 forward. This data is presented on the Purchasing Commodity Data report in CSV format, and represents detailed commodity-level data by purchase order. Additional lines have been added to this dataset to reconcile some document totals from the City's purchasing system to the totals from the City's accounting system in cases when the two amounts are different, which sometimes occurs due to adjustments entered into the accounting system but not the purchasing system. We have removed sensitive information from this data – this is intended to show payments made to entities providing goods and services to the City and County and to protect individuals. For example, we have removed payments to employees (reimbursements, garnishments) and jury members, revenue refunds, payments for judgments and claims, witnesses, relocation and rehousing, and a variety of human services payments. New data is added on a weekly basis.

Supplier payments represent payments to City contractors and vendors that provide goods and/or services to the City. Certain other non-supplier payee payments, which are made to parties other than traditional City contractors and vendors, are also included in this dataset, These include payments made for tax and fee refunds, rebates, settlements, etc.

columns.name: Fiscal Year
columns.description: An accounting period of 12 months. The City and County of San Francisco operates on a fiscal year that begins on July 1 and ends on June 30 the following year. The Fiscal Year ending June 30, 2012 is represented as FY2011-2012.

columns.name: Purchase Order Date
columns.description: The date on which the purchase order was issued.

columns.name: Purchase Order
columns.description: A Purchase Order is a document that reserves a specific amount of money for payment to a vendor for a specific purpose.

columns.name: Purchase Order Line
columns.description: A Purchase Order line is used to allocate a portion of the money reserved by the Purchase Order for a specific type of good or service. Each Purchase Order Line is associated with a Commodity, and each Purchase Order may have one or more Purchase Order Lines.

columns.name: Contract Number
columns.description: The unique identifier of the contract associated with the purchase order

columns.name: Contract Title
columns.description: The title of the contract associated with the purchase order.

columns.name: Purchasing Department
columns.description: Purchasing department represents an organizational unit used by the City and County of San Francisco for purchasing activities. It differs from the Department field used in other datasets in that Department is used for accounting purposes and conforms to the Organization hierarchy, whereas Purchasing Department is used only for purchasing and may have a different naming convention or unstandardized level of detail.

columns.name: Purchasing Department Title
columns.description: Purchasing department represents an organizational unit used by the City and County of San Francisco for purchasing activities. It differs from the Department field used in other datasets in that Department is used for accounting purposes and conforms to the Organization hierarchy, whereas Purchasing Department is used only for purchasing and may have a different naming convention or unstandardized level of detail.

columns.name: Post Date - Original
columns.description: Post Date – Original represents the date on which the document first posted to the City and County of San Francisco’s accounting system.

columns.name: Post Date - Current
columns.description: Post Date – Current represents the most recent date on which the document posted to the City and County of San Francisco’s accounting system. This may be the same as Post Date – Original, or it may be a later date in cases where the document is changed and reposted subsequent to the original posting.

columns.name: Commodity Code
columns.description: Commodity is a highly detailed descriptor used to define types of goods and services procured by the City and County of San Francisco. It is unrelated to the Object hierarchy used in other datasets in that Commodity is more detailed and is used only for purchasing activities, whereas Object is more general and is used for accounting purposes.

columns.name: Commodity Title
columns.description: Commodity is a highly detailed descriptor used to define types of goods and services procured by the City and County of San Francisco. It is unrelated to the Object hierarchy used in other datasets in that Commodity is more detailed and is used only for purchasing activities, whereas Object is more general and is used for accounting purposes.

columns.name: Supplier & Other Non-Supplier Payees
columns.description: An organization that the City pays in return for goods or services.

columns.name: Supplier Street
columns.description: The street address that the City has on file for the vendor

columns.name: Supplier City
columns.description: The city that the City has on file for the vendor

columns.name: Supplier State
columns.description: The state that the City has on file for the vendor

columns.name: Supplier ZIP Code
columns.description: The zip code that the City has on file for the vendor

columns.name: Supplier Contact
columns.description: The contact person that the City has on file for the vendor

columns.name: Supplier Email
columns.description: The contact email address that the City has on file for the vendor

columns.name: Supplier Phone
columns.description: The contact phone number address that the City has on file for the vendor

columns.name: Encumbered Quantity
columns.description: The quantity of goods or services to be purchased under the terms of the Purchase Order. For some non-discrete purchases, like professional service contracts, the Encumbered Quantity is zero.

columns.name: Encumbered Amount
columns.description: The dollar amount of goods or services to be purchased under the terms of the Purchase Order.

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp the data was updated in the source system

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp the data was loaded to the open data portal
